availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Green B. Woodcock (Allen County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Allen County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Polly Meadows Woodcock. Father of William Woodcock, J. W. Woodcock, A. J. Woodcock, M. E. Woodcock, A. E. Woodcock, Lucinda C. Woodcock, Charles G. Woodcock and Florence Edna Woodcock. Resident of Allen County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Allen County in 1840. Farmer in Allen County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Allen County in 1850. Farmer in Allen County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Allen County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
